newsitem.title: POLAND: Number of Poles with bank accounts rises to 31 pct - poll.
newsitem.headline: Number of Poles with bank accounts rises to 31 pct - poll.

text.p: The percentage of people holding a bank account in Poland rose last year by nearly one half to 31 percent, a report released on Friday by the private Pentor polling institute showed.
In February last year 20 percent of Poles had accounts.
The report also said 55 percent of Poles at the start of this year deemed the zloty a solid currency worthy of trust.
